title: Partial disclosure of report activity through new "Export as .zip" feature

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hello Team,
I noticed a new feature has been launched, which allows to export report. Great feature.
But unfortunately it discloses comments of partially disclosed reports which supposed to be hidden..

###POC:
* Go to this partially disclosed report > https://hackerone.com/reports/██████████
* Click **Export** Button.
* You'll see comments are getting disclosed!

{F134909}

This way you can see all the partially disclosed reports comments.

Please let me know if you need more information!

Looking forward!

activities.message:
Here's the easiest way to reproduce:
####open this link -> https://hackerone.com/reports/█████████/export/raw?include_internal_activities=false

For other reports, just change the report id.

Thanks

@faisalahmed, sorry for the delay.

While the issue was resolved yesterday (as you confirmed), we're just finishing up the last bits of our review to make sure there aren't similar cases or that the issue was abused at all besides your and @parth's testing.

I'll go ahead and mark it as Resolved, however, though we will wait on disclosure until that final review is complete. Bounty decision will be coming soon as well.

activities.message:
Hi @faisalahmed,

Sorry for the delay here. We're wrapping up investigation on the issue and making sure the vulnerability is not present in any other location. 

Bounty decision and wrapping up of this report will happen early next week. Please bear with us for a bit.

Thanks again for a great find and we'll keep you posted.
Tom

additional_data.old_title: Comments getting disclosed in "export" feature [partially disclosed reports]
additional_data.new_title: Partial disclosure of report activity through new "Export as .zip" feature

activities.markdown_message:
@faisalahmed, thanks again for this report, and sorry for the delay in getting a bounty paid.

We really do appreciate your assistance here. We are classifying this as "severe", so we're awarding the appropriate bounty based on that categorization.

We look forward to your future reports. Happy hacking!

summaries.content:
This problem was introduced on Monday, November 14th and resolved the following day on Tuesday, November 15th, within one hour of the report being filed. This was an impressive find, and we want to give a huge shout-out to @faisalahmed for bringing this to our attention within 24 hours of releasing the new feature that contained this vulnerability!

When a program has publicly disclosed a report on HackerOne, the platform supports the ability to perform a [limited disclosure](https://support.hackerone.com/hc/en-us/articles/205269479). A normal disclosure includes vulnerability information, attachments, and the full timeline of activity. But a limited disclosure restricts visibility to a summary of the vulnerability and the timeline of activity (comments or actions).

In this particular case, the vulnerability allowed viewing the comments that would normally not be visible in a limited disclosure. Only comments were affected: the report's vulnerability information, attachments, and internal comments were not visible.

HackerOne performed a thorough investigation of all uses of the export functionality and have found no evidence of malicious exploitation of this vulnerability. As part of our standard process, we have notified the programs affected by @faisalahmed and his colleague during the demonstration of the proof of concept to HackerOne.
summaries.content_html:
This problem was introduced on Monday, November 14th and resolved the following day on Tuesday, November 15th, within one hour of the report being filed. This was an impressive find, and we want to give a huge shout-out to @faisalahmed for bringing this to our attention within 24 hours of releasing the new feature that contained this vulnerability!

When a program has publicly disclosed a report on HackerOne, the platform supports the ability to perform a limited disclosure. A normal disclosure includes vulnerability information, attachments, and the full timeline of activity. But a limited disclosure restricts visibility to a summary of the vulnerability and the timeline of activity (comments or actions).

In this particular case, the vulnerability allowed viewing the comments that would normally not be visible in a limited disclosure. Only comments were affected: the report's vulnerability information, attachments, and internal comments were not visible.

HackerOne performed a thorough investigation of all uses of the export functionality and have found no evidence of malicious exploitation of this vulnerability. As part of our standard process, we have notified the programs affected by @faisalahmed and his colleague during the demonstration of the proof of concept to HackerOne.
